A **novel** is a special type of [book](/wiki/Book "Book") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*. When [unidentified](/wiki/Identification "Identification"), a novel appears as a **paperback book**.

Though they do not teach spells, novels are considered [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbook "Spellbook") and can be written with a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker"), taking 5–9 charges to do so. This is subject to failure if novels have not been identified.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

As of [commit 87749392](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/87749392b0f8f3194ffb62bcf7215a932e0b86cb), novels can no longer be written with a [magic marker](/wiki/Magic_marker "Magic marker"), and the [blank spellbook](/wiki/Blank_spellbook "Blank spellbook") you select to write on may be destroyed in the attempt.

As of [commit ed6b78e2](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/commit/ed6b78e227d37e0674e1355cd4cb1d9283f9681a), novels weigh 10 aum instead of 1.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)
- [2 Effect](#Effect)
  - [2.1 List of novels](#List_of_novels)
- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [4 History](#History)
- [5 Variants](#Variants)
  - [5.1 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

## Generation

The first [book or scroll shop](/wiki/Shop "Shop") to be generated in the dungeon is guaranteed to stock a novel.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Novels additionally comprise 0.1% of randomly generated spellbooks. Players and monsters cannot start with a novel, nor will one be granted as a [prayer](/wiki/Prayer "Prayer") boon.

## Effect

[Reading](/wiki/Read "Read") a novel causes *NetHack* to display a quote from a *Discworld* book. The first novel you read gives you 20 points of [experience](/wiki/Experience "Experience"); subsequent novels have no additional effect. Reading novels breaks [illiterate](/wiki/Illiterate "Illiterate") conduct.

### List of novels

- *A Hat Full of Sky*
- *Carpe Jugulum*
- *Equal Rites*
- *Eric*
- *Feet of Clay*
- *Going Postal*
- *Guards! Guards!*
- *Hogfather*
- *Interesting Times*
- *I Shall Wear Midnight*
- *Jingo*
- *Lords and Ladies*
- *Making Money*
- *Maskerade*
- *Men at Arms*
- *Monstrous Regiment*
- *Mort*
- *Moving Pictures*
- *Night Watch*
- *Pyramids*
- *Raising Steam*
- *Reaper Man*
- *Small Gods*
- *Snuff*
- *Soul Music*
- *Sourcery*
- *The Amazing Maurice and his Educated Rodents*
- *The Colour of Magic*
- *The Fifth Elephant*
- *The Last Continent*
- *The Last Hero*
- *The Light Fantastic*
- *The Shepherd's Crown*
- *The Truth*
- *The Wee Free Men*
- *Thief of Time*
- *Thud!*
- *Unseen Academicals*
- *Wintersmith*
- *Witches Abroad*
- *Wyrd Sisters*

## Strategy

Novels are among the many sources of experience that a [pacifist](/wiki/Pacifist "Pacifist") player should make use of early on. Outside of this, they tend to have little practical use.

## History

Novels were introduced in [NetHack 3.6.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.0 "NetHack 3.6.0") as a tribute to [Terry Pratchett](/wiki/Terry_Pratchett "Terry Pratchett"), the author of the *[Discworld](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discworld "wikipedia:Discworld")* series, who passed away in 2015, the year of NetHack 3.6.0's release.

## Variants

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), new novels are added that can be found in some of the branches introduced to the variant:

- [The Blacksmith's Cookbook](/wiki/The_Blacksmith%27s_Cookbook "The Blacksmith's Cookbook") can be found in a [chest](/wiki/Chest "Chest") within the [Goblin Town](/wiki/Goblin_Town "Goblin Town") branch, and details what can be done with the #[forge](/wiki/Forge "Forge") [extended command](/wiki/Extended_command "Extended command").
- [The Adventurer's Journal](/index.php?title=The_Adventurer%27s_Journal\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "The Adventurer's Journal (page does not exist)") is found on the first floor of the [Ice Queen's Realm](/wiki/Ice_Queen%27s_Realm "Ice Queen's Realm"), and contains hints on what can be encountered in that branch.
